If you're traveling outside Victoria for a co-op work term, you may be eligible for a limited $1,000 travel stipend through the Strategic Framework Experiential Learning Fund (SF-ELF). For details, see the section Co-operative Education Travel Awards for Work Terms outside Victoria

Work Duration: 8 or 12 months (An 8 month employment period is registered as 2 separate, consecutive work terms, and a 12 month employment period is registered as 3 separate, consecutive work terms). Please state CLEARLY in your cover letter whether you are available for 8 and/or 12 months.

Note For Engineering Undergraduate Students: Before applying to this posting, it is your responsibility to have completed the appropriate pre-requisite courses for this length of work term, and to understand how this length of work term affects your academics. Engineering undergrads -- If this means you will be registered in a 5th or higher work term, the full co-op tuition fee (equal to two installments) will be charged for each extra work term above the mandatory four.

details.value:
At Motorola Solutions we are helping solve some of the biggest challenges around safety and physical security by developing advanced artificial intelligence (AI) technologies and products that are used to help keep people, businesses, and cities around the world safer. Avigilon, a Motorola Solutions company, designs, develops, and manufactures advanced AI, video analytics, network video management software and hardware, surveillance cameras, and access control solutions that help change the way people interact with their security systems.

Our co-ops don't wash cars or do coffee runs. They also don't work on side projects. Our co-ops are treated like full team members and are given the opportunity to learn what being an electronics design engineer is like in the real world. You'll have the opportunity to learn new technologies and best practices in design, layout, and testing of high speed circuits.

You'll also have a lot of fun and make a lot of friends. For the duration of your work term, you will be a member of a multi-disciplinary engineering team responsible for the design and implementation of the next generation of Motorola's market-leading high-performance video solutions products.

You will work with:

support circuitry for embedded media processors and FPGAs
high-speed digital signaling involving DDR SDRAM, Ethernet, and CMOS image sensors
high-speed, low-noise analog signal conditioning
high-speed clock driver design for image sensors
high-efficiency power supply design
digital and analog control loops
electro-mechanical control and drive circuitry
and microcontroller-based subsystems

Your ability to work productively with vendors, manufacturing personnel, programmers and designers from other disciplines is essential. Proven dedication, tenacity, and the ability to deliver results is a requirement.

Responsibilities include:

Design of electronic circuits using EDA tools including SPICE simulators and schematic capture and PCB layout tools.
Electrical and thermal performance testing of cameras
Ad-hoc building and testing of electronic circuits using electronics workbench tools and test equipment.
Testing, troubleshooting, and kludging of first revisions of electronic circuit boards.
Creation and maintenance of design documentation, assembly trees and bills of materials.
Estimation of work and cost required to complete proposed tasks and the tracking of the work and cost as the tasks progress

Must be available for 8 months work term, minimum.

Qualifications:

Demonstrated enthusiasm for electronics
Demonstrated pragmatic approach to problem solving
Hands-on experience in a testing and troubleshooting role
Strong organizational and documentation skills
Strong understanding of analog and digital circuits, and the ability to critically assess and optimize the performance of designs
Strong soldering and improvisation abilities

We are only going to consider students who are able to commit to a 8 or 12 month Co-Op. Please include this in your cover letter.
